pli-tv-kd8:10.3.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū pātiyāpi pattepi cīvaraṃ omaddanti.
pli-tv-kd8:10.3.8.eng: The monks were kneading the robes in basins and bowls.

pli-tv-kd8:11.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū chamāya cīvaraṃ pattharanti.
pli-tv-kd8:11.1.1.eng: The monks spread the robes on the ground.

pli-tv-kd8:11.1.5.eng: The grass was eaten by termites.

pli-tv-kd8:11.1.7.eng: “I allow a bamboo robe rack and a clothesline.”

pli-tv-kd8:11.1.8.eng: They hung up the robes by the middle.

pli-tv-kd8:11.1.9.eng: The dye dripped from both sides.

pli-tv-kd8:11.1.11.eng: “You should fasten them at the edge.”

pli-tv-kd8:11.1.14.eng: “I allow a string for the edge.”
pli-tv-kd8:11.1.14.comm: Sp 1.85: Yaṁ pana “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, kaṇṇasuttaka”nti evaṁ anuññātaṁ, taṁ anuvāte pāsakaṁ katvā bandhitabbaṁ rajanakāle lagganatthāya, “But that which is allowed in this way, anujānāmi, bhikkhave, kaṇṇasuttaka, having made a loop at the long edge, it is to be bound for the purpose of hanging up at the time of dyeing.”

pli-tv-kd8:11.1.15.eng: The dye dripped from one edge.

pli-tv-kd8:11.1.17.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, samparivattakaṃ samparivattakaṃ rajetuṃ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:11.1.17.eng: “You should dye them by repeatedly turning them over, and you shouldn’t leave while they’re still dripping.”

pli-tv-kd8:11.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena cīvaraṃ patthinnaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:11.2.1.comm: Sp 3.344: Patthinnanti atirajitattā thaddhaṁ, “Patthinna: stiff because of too much dye.”

pli-tv-kd8:11.2.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena cīvaraṃ pharusaṃ hoti.

pli-tv-kd8:11.2.6.eng: “You should beat them with your hands.”

pli-tv-kd8:11.2.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū acchinnakāni cīvarāni dhārenti dantakāsāvāni.
pli-tv-kd8:11.2.7.eng: At that time the monks wore robes consisting of a single piece of cloth, the color of ivory.

pli-tv-kd8:11.2.9.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd8:11.2.11.eng: “You shouldn’t wear robes consisting of a single piece of cloth.

pli-tv-kd8:11.2.12.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd8:12.1.0.eng: 15. The instruction on robes made of pieces

pli-tv-kd8:12.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena dakkhiṇāgiri tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd8:12.1.1.eng: After staying at Rājagaha for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward the southern hills.

pli-tv-kd8:12.1.2.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā magadhakhettaṃ acchibaddhaṃ pāḷibaddhaṃ mariyādabaddhaṃ siṅghāṭakabaddhaṃ, disvāna āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:12.1.2.eng: He saw the fields of Magadha laid out in rectangles defined by long and short boundaries and their intersections. He said to Venerable Ānanda,
pli-tv-kd8:12.1.2.comm: Sp 3.345: Acchibaddhanti caturassakedārakabaddhaṁ, “Acchibaddha: a rectangular field with borders.”

pli-tv-kd8:12.1.3.pli: “passasi no tvaṃ, ānanda, magadhakhettaṃ acchibaddhaṃ pāḷibaddhaṃ mariyādabaddhaṃ siṅghāṭakabaddhan”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:12.1.3.eng: “Ānanda, have a look at these fields.”

pli-tv-kd8:12.1.5.pli: “Ussahasi tvaṃ, ānanda, bhikkhūnaṃ evarūpāni cīvarāni saṃvidahitun”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:12.1.5.eng: “Are you able to make this kind of robe for the monks?”
pli-tv-kd8:12.1.5.comm: Sp 3.345: Saṁvidahitunti kātuṁ, “Saṁvidahituṁ means to make.”

pli-tv-kd8:12.1.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇāgirismiṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā punadeva rājagahaṃ paccāgañchi.
pli-tv-kd8:12.1.7.eng: After staying in the southern hills for as long as he liked, the Buddha returned to Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd8:12.1.8.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando sambahulānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cīvarāni saṃvidahitvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd8:12.1.8.eng: Ānanda then made robes for a number of monks. He went to the Buddha and said,

pli-tv-kd8:12.1.9.eng: “Sir, please have a look at the robes I’ve made.”

pli-tv-kd8:12.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:12.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd8:12.2.2.pli: “paṇḍito, bhikkhave, ānando; mahāpañño, bhikkhave, ānando; yatra hi nāma mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānissati,
pli-tv-kd8:12.2.2.eng: “Ānanda is clever. He understands the detailed meaning of what I’ve spoken in brief.

pli-tv-kd8:12.2.3.pli: kusimpi nāma karissati, aḍḍhakusimpi nāma karissati, maṇḍalampi nāma karissati, aḍḍhamaṇḍalampi nāma karissati, vivaṭṭampi nāma karissati, anuvivaṭṭampi nāma karissati, gīveyyakampi nāma karissati, jaṅgheyyakampi nāma karissati, bāhantampi nāma karissati, chinnakaṃ bhavissati, satthalūkhaṃ samaṇasāruppaṃ paccatthikānañca anabhicchitaṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:12.2.3.eng: He can make long strips, short strips, large panels, medium-sized panels, middle sections, intermediate sections, a neckpiece, a calf-piece, and outer sections. In this way the robe will be made of pieces, making it worthless, appropriate for monastics, and undesirable for one’s enemies.
pli-tv-kd8:12.2.3.comm: Vin-vn-ṭ 563: Kusinti āyāmato ca vitthārato ca anuvātaṁ cīvaramajjhe tādisameva dīghapattañca, “A kusi is a lengthwise or crosswise border in the middle of the robe, just like a long panel.” Vin-vn-ṭ 563: Aḍḍhakusinti anuvātasadisaṁ cīvaramajjhe tattha tattha rassapattaṁ, “An aḍḍhakusi is a short panel like a border, here and there in the middle of the robe.” Sp 3.245: Maṇḍalanti pañcakhaṇḍikacīvarassa ekekasmiṁ khaṇḍe mahāmaṇḍalaṁ, “A maṇḍala is the large panel in each section of a robe with five sections.” Commenting on the vivaṭṭa, “the middle section”, Vin-vn-ṭ 563 says: Vivaṭṭanti maṇḍalaṁ, aḍḍhamaṇḍalañcāti dve ekato katvā sibbitaṁ vemajjhe khaṇḍaṁ, “The vivaṭṭa is the section in the middle, which is made by sewing together a large panel (maṇḍala) and a medium-sized panel (aḍḍhamaṇḍala).” The vivaṭṭa, “section in the middle”, is one of usually five main sections of the robe, see below. Sp 3.245: Vivaṭṭanti maṇḍalañca aḍḍhamaṇḍalañca ekato katvā sibbitaṁ majjhimakhaṇḍaṁ, “The vivaṭṭa is the sewn-together section in the middle, made by making the large panel and the medium-sized panel into one.” Sp 3.245: Anuvivaṭṭanti tassa ubhosu passesu dve khaṇḍāni, “The anuvivaṭṭas are the two sections on either side of it.” Vin-vn-ṭ 563 clarifies that “it” refers to the majjhimakhaṇḍa, “the middle section”. Sp 3.245: Gīveyyakanti gīvāveṭhanaṭṭhāne daḷhīkaraṇatthaṁ aññaṁ suttasaṁsibbitaṁ āgantukapattaṁ, “The gīveyyaka is another added panel, sewn on with thread and for the purpose of strengthening, wrapping the neck area.” Sp 3.245: Jaṅgheyyakanti jaṅghapāpuṇanaṭṭhāne tatheva saṁsibbitaṁ pattaṁ, “The jaṅgheyyaka is a panel sewn on in the same way (as the neckpiece) at the place reaching the calves.” Sp 3.245: Bāhantanti anuvivaṭṭānaṁ bahi ekekaṁ khaṇḍaṁ, “The bāhanta is the single section on the outside of (each of) the intermediate sections.” Sp 3.245 then adds: Iti pañcakhaṇḍikacīvarenetaṁ vicāritanti, “In this way is the layout of a robe with five sections.”

pli-tv-kd8:12.2.4.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, chinnakaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ chinnakaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ chinnakaṃ antaravāsakan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:12.2.4.eng: Your outer robe should be made of pieces and so should your upper robe and sarong.”

pli-tv-kd8:13.1.0.eng: 16. The instruction on the three robes

pli-tv-kd8:13.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena vesālī tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd8:13.1.1.eng: After staying at Rājagaha for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Vesālī.

pli-tv-kd8:13.1.2.pli: Addasa bhagavā antarā ca rājagahaṃ antarā ca vesāliṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno sambahule bhikkhū cīvarehi ubbhaṇḍite sīsepi cīvarabhisiṃ karitvā khandhepi cīvarabhisiṃ karitvā kaṭiyāpi cīvarabhisiṃ karitvā āgacchante, disvāna bhagavato etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd8:13.1.2.eng: On the road between Rājagaha and Vesālī the Buddha saw a number of monks walking along, loaded up with robes on their heads, shoulders, and hips. He thought,

pli-tv-kd8:13.1.3.pli: “atilahuṃ kho ime moghapurisā cīvare bāhullāya āvattā.
pli-tv-kd8:13.1.3.eng: “These foolish men have turned to an abundance in robes too readily.

pli-tv-kd8:13.1.4.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cīvare sīmaṃ bandheyyaṃ, mariyādaṃ ṭhapeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:13.1.4.eng: Let me set a limit on robes for the monks.”

pli-tv-kd8:13.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena vesālī tadavasari. Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati gotamake cetiye.
pli-tv-kd8:13.2.1.eng: Wandering on, the Buddha eventually arrived at Vesālī where he stayed at the Gotamaka Shrine.

pli-tv-kd8:13.2.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā sītāsu hemantikāsu rattīsu antaraṭṭhakāsu himapātasamaye rattiṃ ajjhokāse ekacīvaro nisīdi. Na bhagavantaṃ sītaṃ ahosi.
pli-tv-kd8:13.2.2.eng: At that time it was midwinter, when the days are cold and snowy. The Buddha sat outside at night without being cold, wearing only one robe.

pli-tv-kd8:13.2.3.pli: Nikkhante paṭhame yāme sītaṃ bhagavantaṃ ahosi. Dutiyaṃ bhagavā cīvaraṃ pārupi. Na bhagavantaṃ sītaṃ ahosi.
pli-tv-kd8:13.2.3.eng: Becoming cold at the end of the first part of the night, he put on a second robe.

pli-tv-kd8:13.2.4.pli: Nikkhante majjhime yāme sītaṃ bhagavantaṃ ahosi. Tatiyaṃ bhagavā cīvaraṃ pārupi. Na bhagavantaṃ sītaṃ ahosi.
pli-tv-kd8:13.2.4.eng: Becoming cold once again at the end of the middle part of the night, he put on a third robe.

pli-tv-kd8:13.2.5.pli: Nikkhante pacchime yāme uddhaste aruṇe nandimukhiyā rattiyā sītaṃ bhagavantaṃ ahosi. Catutthaṃ bhagavā cīvaraṃ pārupi. Na bhagavantaṃ sītaṃ ahosi.
pli-tv-kd8:13.2.5.eng: At the end of the last part of the night, when the sky was flaring up at dawn, he became cold once more. Putting on a fourth robe, he was fine.

pli-tv-kd8:13.3.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi—“yepi kho te kulaputtā imasmiṃ dhammavinaye sītālukā sītabhīrukā tepi sakkonti ticīvarena yāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:13.3.1.eng: He thought, “Even those on this spiritual path who come from good families, who are sensitive to the cold and fear the cold, are able to get by with three robes.

pli-tv-kd8:13.3.2.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cīvare sīmaṃ bandheyyaṃ, mariyādaṃ ṭhapeyyaṃ, ticīvaraṃ anujāneyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:13.3.2.eng: Let me set a limit on robes for the monks. Let me allow them three robes.”

pli-tv-kd8:13.3.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:13.3.3.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks.

pli-tv-kd8:13.4.1.pli: “idhāhaṃ, bhikkhave, antarā ca rājagahaṃ antarā ca vesāliṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno addasaṃ sambahule bhikkhū cīvarehi ubbhaṇḍite sīsepi cīvarabhisiṃ karitvā khandhepi cīvarabhisiṃ karitvā kaṭiyāpi cīvarabhisiṃ karitvā āgacchante, disvāna me etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd8:13.4.1.eng: He told them what had happened

pli-tv-kd8:13.4.2.pli: ‘atilahuṃ kho ime moghapurisā cīvare bāhullāya āvattā.

pli-tv-kd8:13.4.3.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cīvare sīmaṃ bandheyyaṃ, mariyādaṃ ṭhapeyyan’ti.

pli-tv-kd8:13.5.1.pli: Idhāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sītāsu hemantikāsu rattīsu antaraṭṭhakāsu himapātasamaye rattiṃ ajjhokāse ekacīvaro nisīdiṃ. Na maṃ sītaṃ ahosi.

pli-tv-kd8:13.5.2.pli: Nikkhante paṭhame yāme sītaṃ maṃ ahosi. Dutiyāhaṃ cīvaraṃ pārupiṃ. Na maṃ sītaṃ ahosi.

pli-tv-kd8:13.5.3.pli: Nikkhante majjhime yāme sītaṃ maṃ ahosi. Tatiyāhaṃ cīvaraṃ pārupiṃ. Na maṃ sītaṃ ahosi.

pli-tv-kd8:13.5.4.pli: Nikkhante pacchime yāme uddhaste aruṇe nandimukhiyā rattiyā sītaṃ maṃ ahosi. Catutthāhaṃ cīvaraṃ pārupiṃ. Na maṃ sītaṃ ahosi.

pli-tv-kd8:13.5.5.eng: and what he had thought, adding:

pli-tv-kd8:13.5.6.pli: ‘yepi kho te kulaputtā imasmiṃ dhammavinaye sītālukā sītabhīrukā tepi sakkonti ticīvarena yāpetuṃ.

pli-tv-kd8:13.5.7.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cīvare sīmaṃ bandheyyaṃ, mariyādaṃ ṭhapeyyaṃ, ticīvaraṃ anujāneyyan’ti.

pli-tv-kd8:13.5.8.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ticīvaraṃ—diguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ, ekacciyaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ, ekacciyaṃ antaravāsakan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:13.5.8.eng: “I allow you three robes: a double-layered outer robe, a single-layered upper robe, and a single-layered sarong.”

pli-tv-kd8:13.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—“bhagavatā ticīvaraṃ anuññātan”ti—
pli-tv-kd8:13.6.1.eng: When they heard that the Buddha had allowed three robes,

pli-tv-kd8:13.6.2.pli: aññeneva ticīvarena gāmaṃ pavisanti, aññena ticīvarena ārāme acchanti, aññena ticīvarena nahānaṃ otaranti.
pli-tv-kd8:13.6.2.eng: the monks from the group of six went to the village in one set of three, stayed in the monastery in another set, and went bathing in yet another set.

pli-tv-kd8:13.6.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd8:13.6.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd8:13.6.4.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six keep extra robes?”

pli-tv-kd8:13.6.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd8:13.6.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:13.6.6.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd8:13.6.8.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd8:13.7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato ānandassa atirekacīvaraṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:13.7.1.eng: Soon, Venerable Ānanda was offered an extra robe.

pli-tv-kd8:13.7.2.pli: Āyasmā ca ānando taṃ cīvaraṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa dātukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:13.7.2.eng: He wanted to give it to Venerable Sāriputta

pli-tv-kd8:13.7.5.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,

pli-tv-kd8:13.7.11.eng: He told the Buddha, who said,

pli-tv-kd8:13.7.12.eng: “How long is it, Ānanda, before Sāriputta returns?”

pli-tv-kd8:13.7.14.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:13.7.14.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd8:13.7.15.eng: “You should keep an extra robe for ten days at the most.”

pli-tv-kd8:13.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhūnaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:13.8.1.eng: Soon the monks were given extra robes.

pli-tv-kd8:13.8.3.eng: Not knowing what to do with them,

pli-tv-kd8:13.8.5.eng: “I allow you to assign an extra robe to another.”
pli-tv-kd8:13.8.5.comm: For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd8:14.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena bārāṇasī tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd8:14.1.1.eng: After staying at Vesālī for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Benares.

pli-tv-kd8:14.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena bārāṇasī tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd8:14.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ viharati isipatane migadāye.
pli-tv-kd8:14.1.3.eng: he stayed in the deer park at Isipattana.

pli-tv-kd8:14.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno antaravāsako chiddo hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:14.1.4.eng: On that occasion the sarong of a certain monk had a hole.

pli-tv-kd8:14.1.7.pli: diguṇā saṅghāṭi, ekacciyo uttarāsaṅgo, ekacciyo antaravāsako.
pli-tv-kd8:14.1.7.eng: a double-layered outer robe, a single-layered upper robe, and a single-layered sarong.

pli-tv-kd8:14.1.8.eng: Since my sarong has a hole,

pli-tv-kd8:14.1.9.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ aggaḷaṃ acchupeyyaṃ, samantato dupaṭṭaṃ bhavissati, majjhe ekacciyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:14.1.9.eng: let me add a patch. It will have a double layer of cloth on all sides, but only a single layer in the middle.”
pli-tv-kd8:14.1.9.comm: The point, presumably, is that there would be a double layer of cloth wherever the patch overlapped with the original robe, but only a single layer over the hole.

pli-tv-kd8:14.2.1.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu aggaḷaṃ acchupesi.

pli-tv-kd8:14.2.2.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍanto taṃ bhikkhuṃ aggaḷaṃ acchupentaṃ, disvāna yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd8:14.2.2.eng: Just then the Buddha was walking about the dwellings, and he saw that monk patching his robe. He went up to that monk and said,

pli-tv-kd8:14.2.6.pli: sādhu kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, aggaḷaṃ acchupesī”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:14.2.6.eng: It’s good that you are patching your robe.”

pli-tv-kd8:14.2.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:14.2.7.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd8:14.2.8.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ahatānaṃ dussānaṃ ahatakappānaṃ diguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ, ekacciyaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ, ekacciyaṃ antaravāsakaṃ;
pli-tv-kd8:14.2.8.eng: “When the cloth is new or nearly new, I allow a double-layered outer robe, a single-layered upper robe, and a single-layered sarong.

pli-tv-kd8:14.2.9.pli: utuddhaṭānaṃ dussānaṃ catugguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ, diguṇaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ, diguṇaṃ antaravāsakaṃ;
pli-tv-kd8:14.2.9.eng: When the cloth is worn, I allow an outer robe of four layers, a double-layered upper robe, and a double-layered sarong.

pli-tv-kd8:14.2.10.eng: With rags, you may have as much as you like.

pli-tv-kd8:14.2.11.eng: With scraps of cloth from a shop, you should search for them.

pli-tv-kd8:14.2.12.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, aggaḷaṃ tunnaṃ ovaṭṭikaṃ kaṇḍusakaṃ daḷhīkamman”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:14.2.12.eng: And I allow patches, mending, hems, strips of cloth for marking, and strengthening.”
pli-tv-kd8:14.2.12.comm: For a discussion of rendering aggaḷa as “patch”, see Appendix of Technical Terms. Sp 3.348: Suttena saṁsibbitaṁ tunnaṁ, “Tunna is the sewing on (of the patch) with a thread.” Sp 3.348: Vaṭṭetvā karaṇaṁ ovaṭṭikaṁ, “Having folded, there is the making of the ovaṭṭika.” Sp 3.348: Kaṇḍusakaṁ vuccati muddikā, “Calculating is called kaṇḍusaka.” Vjb 3.308 adds: Kaṇḍusaṁ nāma pubbabandhana, “Kaṇḍusa is a prior fixing.” The meaning of this is not clear to me. I follow the definition given in CPD. See also Kd 7:1.5.9.

pli-tv-kd8:15.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd8:15.1.1.eng: After staying at Benares for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd8:15.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd8:15.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd8:15.1.3.eng: he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd8:15.1.4.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd8:15.1.4.eng: Soon afterwards Visākhā Migāramātā went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd8:15.1.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho visākhaṃ migāramātaraṃ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd8:15.1.5.eng: When the Buddha had instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching,

pli-tv-kd8:15.1.6.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd8:15.1.7.pli: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.1.7.eng: “Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.1.8.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd8:15.1.9.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd8:15.1.9.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Visākhā got up from her seat, bowed down, circumambulated him with her right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd8:15.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tassā rattiyā accayena cātuddīpiko mahāmegho pāvassi.
pli-tv-kd8:15.2.1.eng: The following morning it was pouring down from a great storm extending over the four continents.

pli-tv-kd8:15.2.2.eng: The Buddha said to the monks,

pli-tv-kd8:15.2.3.pli: “yathā, bhikkhave, jetavane vassati evaṃ catūsu dīpesu vassati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.2.3.eng: “It rains on the four continents just as it rains here in the Jeta Grove.

pli-tv-kd8:15.2.5.eng: This is the last great storm of this kind.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.2.6.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā nikkhittacīvarā kāyaṃ ovassāpenti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.2.6.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” they took off their robes and bathed in the rain.

pli-tv-kd8:15.3.1.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā dāsiṃ āṇāpesi—
pli-tv-kd8:15.3.1.eng: When Visākhā had had various kinds of fine foods prepared, she told a slave,

pli-tv-kd8:15.3.2.pli: “gaccha, je. Ārāmaṃ gantvā kālaṃ ārocehi—kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.3.2.eng: “Go to the monastery and tell the Buddha that the meal is ready.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.3.3.pli: “Evaṃ, ayye”ti kho sā dāsī visākhāya migāramātuyā paṭissuṇitvā ārāmaṃ gantvā addasa bhikkhū nikkhittacīvare kāyaṃ ovassāpente, disvāna—
pli-tv-kd8:15.3.3.eng: Saying, “Yes, ma’am,” she went to the monastery and saw the monks bathing naked in the rain. She thought,

pli-tv-kd8:15.3.4.eng: “There are no monks in the monastery, just Ājīvaka ascetics bathing in the rain.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.3.5.pli: yena visākhā migāramātā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā visākhaṃ migāramātaraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd8:15.3.5.eng: She returned and told Visākhā what had happened.

pli-tv-kd8:15.3.7.pli: Atha kho visākhāya migāramātuyā paṇḍitāya viyattāya medhāviniyā etadahosi—“nissaṃsayaṃ kho ayyā nikkhittacīvarā kāyaṃ ovassāpenti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.3.7.eng: Being wise and discerning, Visākhā thought, “No doubt the venerables are bathing naked in the rain.

pli-tv-kd8:15.3.8.pli: Sāyaṃ bālā maññittha—natthi ārāme bhikkhū, ājīvakā kāyaṃ ovassāpentī”ti, puna dāsiṃ āṇāpesi—
pli-tv-kd8:15.3.8.eng: It’s only because of her ignorance that she thinks as she does.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.3.9.pli: “gaccha, je. Ārāmaṃ gantvā kālaṃ ārocehi—kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.3.9.eng: So she sent the slave back to the monastery with the same instructions.

pli-tv-kd8:15.4.1.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū gattāni sītiṃ karitvā kallakāyā cīvarāni gahetvā yathāvihāraṃ pavisiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd8:15.4.1.eng: When the monks had cooled their bodies and felt invigorated, they took their robes and entered their dwellings.

pli-tv-kd8:15.4.2.pli: Atha kho sā dāsī ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhū apassantī—
pli-tv-kd8:15.4.2.eng: When the slave arrived, she didn’t see any monks. She thought,

pli-tv-kd8:15.4.3.eng: “There are no monks in the monastery. It’s empty.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.4.4.pli: yena visākhā migāramātā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā visākhaṃ migāramātaraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd8:15.4.4.eng: She returned and told Visākhā what had happened.

pli-tv-kd8:15.4.6.pli: Atha kho visākhāya migāramātuyā paṇḍitāya viyattāya medhāviniyā etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd8:15.4.6.eng: Once again Visākhā realized what was going on,

pli-tv-kd8:15.4.7.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho ayyā gattāni sītiṃ karitvā kallakāyā cīvarāni gahetvā yathāvihāraṃ paviṭṭhā.

pli-tv-kd8:15.4.8.pli: Sāyaṃ bālā maññittha—natthi ārāme bhikkhū, suñño ārāmo”ti, puna dāsiṃ āṇāpesi—

pli-tv-kd8:15.4.9.pli: “gaccha, je. Ārāmaṃ gantvā kālaṃ ārocehi—kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.4.9.eng: and she told the slave to go to the monastery one more time.

pli-tv-kd8:15.5.1.eng: When the message had been delivered, the Buddha said to the monks,

pli-tv-kd8:15.5.2.eng: “Get your bowls and robes. It’s time for the meal.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.5.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

pli-tv-kd8:15.5.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya—
pli-tv-kd8:15.5.4.eng: The Buddha robed up and took his bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd8:15.5.5.pli: seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evameva—jetavane antarahito visākhāya migāramātuyā koṭṭhake pāturahosi.
pli-tv-kd8:15.5.5.eng: Then, just as a strong man might bend or stretch his arm, the Buddha disappeared from the Jeta Grove and appeared at Visākhā’s gatehouse.

pli-tv-kd8:15.5.6.pli: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd8:15.5.6.eng: He sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd8:15.6.1.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā—“acchariyaṃ vata bho, abbhutaṃ vata bho.
pli-tv-kd8:15.6.1.eng: Visākhā thought, “The power and might of the Buddha are truly amazing.

pli-tv-kd8:15.6.2.pli: Tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā, yatra hi nāma jaṇṇukamattesupi oghesu pavattamānesu, kaṭimattesupi oghesu pavattamānesu, na hi nāma ekabhikkhussapi pādā vā cīvarāni vā allāni bhavissantī”ti—
pli-tv-kd8:15.6.2.eng: The water is flowing knee-deep, even waist-deep, yet not a single monk has wet feet or wet robes.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.6.3.pli: haṭṭhā udaggā buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd8:15.6.3.eng: Delighted and joyful, she personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, she sat down to one side

pli-tv-kd8:15.6.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho visākhā migāramātā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd8:15.6.5.eng: “Sir, I wish to ask for eight favors.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.6.7.pli: “Yāni ca, bhante, kappiyāni yāni ca anavajjānī”ti.

pli-tv-kd8:15.7.1.pli: “Icchāmahaṃ, bhante, saṅghassa yāvajīvaṃ vassikasāṭikaṃ dātuṃ, āgantukabhattaṃ dātuṃ, gamikabhattaṃ dātuṃ, gilānabhattaṃ dātuṃ, gilānupaṭṭhākabhattaṃ dātuṃ, gilānabhesajjaṃ dātuṃ, dhuvayāguṃ dātuṃ, bhikkhunisaṅghassa udakasāṭikaṃ dātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.7.1.eng: “For as long as I live I wish to give rainy-season robes to the Sangha, and I wish to give meals to the newly-arrived and departing monastics, as well as to those who are sick and those nursing the sick. I also wish to give medicines to the sick, a regular supply of congee, and bathing robes to the nuns.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.7.2.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, visākhe, atthavasaṃ sampassamānā tathāgataṃ aṭṭha varāni yācasī”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:15.7.2.eng: “But, Visākhā, what reason do you have for asking me for these eight favors?”

pli-tv-kd8:15.7.3.eng: Visākhā then told the Buddha what had happened to her slave,

pli-tv-kd8:15.7.4.pli: ‘gaccha, je. Ārāmaṃ gantvā kālaṃ ārocehi—kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan’ti.

pli-tv-kd8:15.7.5.pli: Atha kho sā, bhante, dāsī ārāmaṃ gantvā addasa bhikkhū nikkhittacīvare kāyaṃ ovassāpente, disvāna—

pli-tv-kd8:15.7.9.eng: adding, “Nakedness is gross, disgusting, and repulsive.

pli-tv-kd8:15.7.10.pli: Imāhaṃ, bhante, atthavasaṃ sampassamānā icchāmi saṅghassa yāvajīvaṃ vassikasāṭikaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:15.7.10.eng: This is why I wish to give rainy-season robes to the Sangha for as long as I live.

pli-tv-kd8:15.8.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhante, āgantuko bhikkhu na vīthikusalo na gocarakusalo kilanto piṇḍāya carati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.1.eng: Also, not knowing the streets or where to go, newly-arrived monks will get exhausted while walking for alms.

pli-tv-kd8:15.8.2.pli: So me āgantukabhattaṃ bhuñjitvā vīthikusalo gocarakusalo akilanto piṇḍāya carissati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.2.eng: But if they eat a meal from me, they will get to know the streets and where to go for alms, and they will avoid getting exhausted.

pli-tv-kd8:15.8.3.pli: Imāhaṃ, bhante, atthavasaṃ sampassamānā icchāmi saṅghassa yāvajīvaṃ āgantukabhattaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.3.eng: This is why I wish to give meals to the newly-arrived monks for as long as I live.

pli-tv-kd8:15.8.4.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhante, gamiko bhikkhu attano bhattaṃ pariyesamāno satthā vā vihāyissati, yattha vā vāsaṃ gantukāmo bhavissati tattha vikāle upagacchissati, kilanto addhānaṃ gamissati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.4.eng: Also, in trying to get a meal, departing monks may bother the Teacher, or they may arrive late at their destination. Or, if they fail to get a meal, they’ll be weak while traveling.

pli-tv-kd8:15.8.5.pli: So me gamikabhattaṃ bhuñjitvā satthā na vihāyissati, yattha vāsaṃ gantukāmo bhavissati tattha kāle upagacchissati, akilanto addhānaṃ gamissati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.5.eng: But if they eat a meal from me, they won’t bother the Teacher, they’ll arrive at their destination at an appropriate time, and they won’t be weak while traveling.

pli-tv-kd8:15.8.6.pli: Imāhaṃ, bhante, atthavasaṃ sampassamānā icchāmi saṅghassa yāvajīvaṃ gamikabhattaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.6.eng: This is why I wish to give meals to the departing monks for as long as I live.

pli-tv-kd8:15.9.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhante, gilānassa bhikkhuno sappāyāni bhojanāni alabhantassa ābādho vā abhivaḍḍhissati, kālaṅkiriyā vā bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.1.eng: Also, if sick monks don’t get suitable food, their illness might get worse, or they might die.

pli-tv-kd8:15.9.2.pli: Tassa me gilānabhattaṃ bhuttassa ābādho na abhivaḍḍhissati, kālaṅkiriyā na bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.2.eng: But if they eat a meal from me, their illness won’t get worse, and they won’t die.

pli-tv-kd8:15.9.3.pli: Imāhaṃ, bhante, atthavasaṃ sampassamānā icchāmi saṅghassa yāvajīvaṃ gilānabhattaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.3.eng: This is why I wish to give meals to the sick monks for as long as I live.

pli-tv-kd8:15.9.4.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhante, gilānupaṭṭhāko bhikkhu attano bhattaṃ pariyesamāno gilānassa ussūre bhattaṃ nīharissati, bhattacchedaṃ karissati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.4.eng: Also, if the monks who nurse the sick have to get their own meals, they won’t be able to bring back meals for the sick until after midday, and then the sick won’t be able to eat.

pli-tv-kd8:15.9.5.pli: So me gilānupaṭṭhākabhattaṃ bhuñjitvā gilānassa kālena bhattaṃ nīharissati, bhattacchedaṃ na karissati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.5.eng: But if they eat a meal from me, they’ll be able to bring back meals for the sick in good time, and the sick will be able to eat.

pli-tv-kd8:15.9.6.pli: Imāhaṃ, bhante, atthavasaṃ sampassamānā icchāmi saṅghassa yāvajīvaṃ gilānupaṭṭhākabhattaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.6.eng: This is why I wish to give meals to those monks who nurse the sick for as long as I live.

pli-tv-kd8:15.10.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhante, gilānassa bhikkhuno sappāyāni bhesajjāni alabhantassa ābādho vā abhivaḍḍhissati, kālaṅkiriyā vā bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.10.1.eng: Also, if the sick monks don’t get suitable medicines, their illness might get worse or they might die.

pli-tv-kd8:15.10.2.pli: Tassa me gilānabhesajjaṃ paribhuttassa ābādho na abhivaḍḍhissati, kālaṅkiriyā na bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.10.2.eng: But if they get medicine from me, their illness won’t get worse, and they won’t die.

pli-tv-kd8:15.10.3.pli: Imāhaṃ, bhante, atthavasaṃ sampassamānā icchāmi saṅghassa yāvajīvaṃ gilānabhesajjaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:15.10.3.eng: This is why I wish to give medicine to the Sangha for as long as I live.

pli-tv-kd8:15.10.4.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā andhakavinde dasānisaṃse sampassamānena yāgu anuññātā.
pli-tv-kd8:15.10.4.eng: Also, while staying at Andhakavinda, the Buddha allowed congee, seeing ten benefits in it.

pli-tv-kd8:15.10.5.pli: Tyāhaṃ, bhante, ānisaṃse sampassamānā icchāmi saṅghassa yāvajīvaṃ dhuvayāguṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:15.10.5.eng: This is why I wish to give a regular supply of congee to the Sangha for as long as I live.

pli-tv-kd8:15.11.1.pli: Idha, bhante, bhikkhuniyo aciravatiyā nadiyā vesiyāhi saddhiṃ naggā ekatitthe nahāyanti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.11.1.eng: Also, sir, on one occasion the nuns were bathing naked at a ford in the river Aciravatī together with sex workers.

pli-tv-kd8:15.11.3.pli: ‘kiṃ nu kho nāma tumhākaṃ, ayye, daharānaṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciṇṇena, nanu nāma kāmā paribhuñjitabbā;
pli-tv-kd8:15.11.3.eng: ‘Venerables, why practice the spiritual life when you’re still young? Why not enjoy worldly pleasures?

pli-tv-kd8:15.11.4.pli: yadā jiṇṇā bhavissatha tadā brahmacariyaṃ carissatha.
pli-tv-kd8:15.11.4.eng: You can practice the spiritual life when you’re old.

pli-tv-kd8:15.11.5.pli: Evaṃ tumhākaṃ ubho atthā pariggahitā bhavissantī’ti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.11.5.eng: In this way you’ll get the benefits of both.’

pli-tv-kd8:15.11.6.pli: Tā, bhante, bhikkhuniyo vesiyāhi uppaṇḍiyamānā maṅkū ahesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd8:15.11.7.pli: Asuci, bhante, mātugāmassa naggiyaṃ jegucchaṃ paṭikūlaṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:15.11.7.eng: Nakedness in women is gross, disgusting, and repulsive.

pli-tv-kd8:15.11.8.pli: Imāhaṃ, bhante, atthavasaṃ sampassamānā icchāmi bhikkhunisaṅghassa yāvajīvaṃ udakasāṭikaṃ dātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.11.8.eng: This is why I wish to give bathing robes to the Sangha of nuns for as long as I live.”
pli-tv-kd8:15.11.8.comm: See also Bi Pc 21, which prohibits a nun from bathing naked.

pli-tv-kd8:15.12.1.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, visākhe, ānisaṃsaṃ sampassamānā tathāgataṃ aṭṭha varāni yācasī”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:15.12.1.eng: “But, Visākhā, what benefit do you see that you ask me for these eight favors?”

pli-tv-kd8:15.12.2.pli: “Idha, bhante, disāsu vassaṃvuṭṭhā bhikkhū sāvatthiṃ āgacchissanti bhagavantaṃ dassanāya.
pli-tv-kd8:15.12.2.eng: “Well, it will happen that monks who have completed the rainy-season residence in the various regions will come to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd8:15.12.4.pli: ‘itthannāmo, bhante, bhikkhu kālaṅkato, tassa kā gati ko abhisamparāyo’ti?
pli-tv-kd8:15.12.4.eng: they’ll ask you about his destination,

pli-tv-kd8:15.12.5.pli: Taṃ bhagavā byākarissati sotāpattiphale vā sakadāgāmiphale vā anāgāmiphale vā arahatte vā.
pli-tv-kd8:15.12.5.eng: and you’ll tell them whether he’s reached the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, or perfection.

pli-tv-kd8:15.12.7.pli: ‘āgatapubbā nu kho, bhante, tena ayyena sāvatthī’ti?
pli-tv-kd8:15.12.7.eng: whether that dead monk had previously visited Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd8:15.13.3.pli: ‘nissaṃsayaṃ me paribhuttaṃ tena ayyena vassikasāṭikā vā āgantukabhattaṃ vā gamikabhattaṃ vā gilānabhattaṃ vā gilānupaṭṭhākabhattaṃ vā gilānabhesajjaṃ vā dhuvayāgu vā’ti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.13.3.eng: ‘No doubt that venerable will have enjoyed a rainy-season robe supplied by me. Or he will have enjoyed a meal for newly-arrived monks, a meal for departing monks, a meal for sick monks, a meal for those nursing the sick, medicines, or a regular supply of congee—all given by me.’

pli-tv-kd8:15.13.4.pli: Tassā me tadanussarantiyā pāmujjaṃ jāyissati, pamuditāya pīti jāyissati, pītimanāya kāyo passambhissati, passaddhakāyā sukhaṃ vediyissāmi, sukhiniyā cittaṃ samādhiyissati.
pli-tv-kd8:15.13.4.eng: When I recall that, I’ll be glad. The gladness will give rise to joy, and the mental joy will make me tranquil. When I’m tranquil, I’ll feel bliss. And when I’m blissful, my mind will be stilled.

pli-tv-kd8:15.13.5.pli: Sā me bhavissati indriyabhāvanā balabhāvanā bojjhaṅgabhāvanā.
pli-tv-kd8:15.13.5.eng: In this way I’ll develop the spiritual faculties, the spiritual powers, and the factors of awakening.

pli-tv-kd8:15.13.6.pli: Imāhaṃ, bhante, ānisaṃsaṃ sampassamānā tathāgataṃ aṭṭha varāni yācāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.13.6.eng: It’s because of this benefit that I ask for these eight favors.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.14.2.pli: sādhu kho tvaṃ, visākhe, imaṃ ānisaṃsaṃ sampassamānā tathāgataṃ aṭṭha varāni yācasi.
pli-tv-kd8:15.14.2.eng: It’s good that you ask me for these eight favors for the sake of this benefit.

pli-tv-kd8:15.14.3.eng: I grant you these eight favors.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.14.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā visākhaṃ migāramātaraṃ imāhi gāthāhi anumodi—
pli-tv-kd8:15.14.4.eng: The Buddha then expressed his appreciation to Visākhā with these verses:

pli-tv-kd8:15.14.6.eng: A virtuous disciple of the Accomplished One,

pli-tv-kd8:15.14.8.eng: It leads to heaven, eliminates sadness, and brings bliss.

pli-tv-kd8:15.14.9.eng: By means of the stainless path,

pli-tv-kd8:15.14.10.eng: She obtains heaven and long life.

pli-tv-kd8:15.14.12.eng: She rejoices in heaven for a long time.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.14.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā visākhaṃ migāramātaraṃ imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd8:15.14.13.eng: When the Buddha had expressed his appreciation, he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd8:15.15.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:15.15.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd8:15.15.2.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, vassikasāṭikaṃ, āgantukabhattaṃ, gamikabhattaṃ, gilānabhattaṃ, gilānupaṭṭhākabhattaṃ, gilānabhesajjaṃ, dhuvayāguṃ, bhikkhunisaṅghassa udakasāṭikan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:15.15.2.eng: “I allow a rainy-season robe, meals for newly-arrived monastics, meals for departing monastics, meals for the sick, meals for those nursing the sick, medicine for the sick, a regular supply of congee, and bathing robes for the Sangha of nuns.”

pli-tv-kd8:15.15.3.eng: The section for recitation on Visākhā is finished.

pli-tv-kd8:16.1.0.eng: 19. The allowance of a sitting mat

pli-tv-kd8:16.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū paṇītāni bhojanāni bhuñjitvā muṭṭhassatī asampajānā niddaṃ okkamanti.
pli-tv-kd8:16.1.1.eng: At one time the monks ate fine food, and then went to sleep absentminded and heedless.

pli-tv-kd8:16.1.2.pli: Tesaṃ muṭṭhassatīnaṃ asampajānānaṃ niddaṃ okkamantānaṃ supinantena asuci muccati, senāsanaṃ asucinā makkhiyati.
pli-tv-kd8:16.1.2.eng: They emitted semen while dreaming, soiling the furniture.
pli-tv-kd8:16.1.2.comm: “Furniture” renders senāsana. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd8:16.1.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmatā ānandena pacchāsamaṇena senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍanto addasa senāsanaṃ asucinā makkhitaṃ, disvāna āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:16.1.3.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha was walking about the dwellings with Venerable Ānanda as his attendant. Noticing that soiled furniture, he asked Ānanda what had happened.

pli-tv-kd8:16.1.5.pli: “Etarahi, bhante, bhikkhū paṇītāni bhojanāni bhuñjitvā muṭṭhassatī asampajānā niddaṃ okkamanti.

pli-tv-kd8:16.1.6.pli: Tesaṃ muṭṭhassatīnaṃ asampajānānaṃ niddaṃ okkamantānaṃ supinantena asuci muccati;

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.1.eng: and the Buddha said, “That’s how it is, Ānanda.

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.2.pli: Muccati hi, ānanda, muṭṭhassatīnaṃ asampajānānaṃ niddaṃ okkamantānaṃ supinantena asuci.
pli-tv-kd8:16.2.2.eng: For those who go to sleep absentminded and heedless, semen is emitted while dreaming.

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.3.pli: Ye te, ānanda, bhikkhū upaṭṭhitassatī sampajānā niddaṃ okkamanti, tesaṃ asuci na muccati.
pli-tv-kd8:16.2.3.eng: But for those who fall asleep mindful and heedful, this doesn’t happen,

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.4.pli: Yepi te, ānanda, puthujjanā kāmesu vītarāgā, tesampi asuci na muccati.
pli-tv-kd8:16.2.4.eng: nor does it for ordinary people who are free from sensual desire.

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.5.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, ānanda, anavakāso yaṃ arahato asuci mucceyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:16.2.5.eng: And, Ānanda, it’s impossible for a perfected one to emit semen.”

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:16.2.6.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks,

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.7.pli: “idhāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ānandena pacchāsamaṇena senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍanto addasaṃ senāsanaṃ asucinā makkhitaṃ, disvāna ānandaṃ āmantesiṃ—

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.9.pli: ‘Etarahi, bhante, bhikkhū paṇītāni bhojanāni bhuñjitvā muṭṭhassatī asampajānā niddaṃ okkamanti.

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.10.pli: Tesaṃ muṭṭhassatīnaṃ asampajānānaṃ niddaṃ okkamantānaṃ supinantena asuci muccati;

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.12.pli: ‘Evametaṃ, ānanda, evametaṃ, ānanda, muccati hi, ānanda, muṭṭhassatīnaṃ asampajānānaṃ niddaṃ okkamantānaṃ supinantena asuci.

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.13.pli: Ye te, ānanda, bhikkhū upaṭṭhitassatī sampajānā niddaṃ okkamanti, tesaṃ asuci na muccati.

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.14.pli: Yepi te, ānanda, puthujjanā kāmesu vītarāgā tesampi asuci na muccati.

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.15.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, ānanda, anavakāso yaṃ arahato asuci mucceyyā’ti.

pli-tv-kd8:16.3.1.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, ādīnavā muṭṭhassatissa asampajānassa niddaṃ okkamato—
pli-tv-kd8:16.3.1.eng: “There are these five drawbacks to going to sleep absentminded and heedless:

pli-tv-kd8:16.3.2.pli: dukkhaṃ supati, dukkhaṃ paṭibujjhati, pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passati, devatā na rakkhanti, asuci muccati.
pli-tv-kd8:16.3.2.eng: you don’t sleep well; you wake up feeling miserable; you have nightmares; the gods don’t guard you; and you emit semen.

pli-tv-kd8:16.3.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ādīnavā muṭṭhassatissa asampajānassa niddaṃ okkamato.

pli-tv-kd8:16.3.4.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā upaṭṭhitassatissa sampajānassa niddaṃ okkamato—
pli-tv-kd8:16.3.4.eng: And there are these five benefits in going to sleep mindful and heedful:

pli-tv-kd8:16.3.5.pli: sukhaṃ supati, sukhaṃ paṭibujjhati, na pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passati, devatā rakkhanti, asuci na muccati.
pli-tv-kd8:16.3.5.eng: you sleep well; you wake up feeling good; you don’t have nightmares; the gods guard you; and you don’t emit semen.

pli-tv-kd8:16.3.6.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ānisaṃsā upaṭṭhitassatissa sampajānassa niddaṃ okkamato.

pli-tv-kd8:16.3.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, kāyaguttiyā cīvaraguttiyā senāsanaguttiyā nisīdanan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:16.3.7.eng: And, monks, I allow a sitting mat to protect the body, the robes, and the furniture.”
pli-tv-kd8:16.3.7.comm: “Sitting mat” renders nisīdana. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd8:16.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena atikhuddakaṃ nisīdanaṃ na sabbaṃ senāsanaṃ saṅgopeti.
pli-tv-kd8:16.4.1.eng: But the sitting mat was too small. It did not protect the entire piece of furniture.

pli-tv-kd8:16.4.3.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yāvamahantaṃ paccattharaṇaṃ ākaṅkhati tāvamahantaṃ paccattharaṇaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:16.4.3.eng: “I allow you to make a sheet as large as you like.”

pli-tv-kd8:17.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato ānandassa upajjhāyassa āyasmato belaṭṭhasīsassa thullakacchābādho hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:17.1.1.eng: On one occasion Venerable Ānanda’s preceptor, Venerable Belaṭṭhasīsa, had carbuncles,

pli-tv-kd8:17.1.2.eng: with pus causing his robes to stick to his body.

pli-tv-kd8:17.1.3.pli: Tāni bhikkhū udakena temetvā temetvā apakaḍḍhanti.
pli-tv-kd8:17.1.3.eng: To detach them, the monks kept on moistening his robes with water.

pli-tv-kd8:17.1.4.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍanto te bhikkhū tāni cīvarāni udakena temetvā temetvā apakaḍḍhante, disvāna yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd8:17.1.4.eng: As the Buddha was walking about the dwellings, he noticed the monks doing this. He went up to them and said,

pli-tv-kd8:17.1.8.pli: Tāni mayaṃ udakena temetvā temetvā apakaḍḍhāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd8:17.1.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:17.1.9.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd8:17.1.10.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yassa kaṇḍu vā piḷakā vā assāvo vā thullakacchu vā ābādho kaṇḍuppaṭicchādin”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:17.1.10.eng: “For anyone who has an itch, a boil, a running sore, or a carbuncle, I allow an itch-covering cloth.”

pli-tv-kd8:18.1.1.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā mukhapuñchanacoḷaṃ ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd8:18.1.1.eng: On one occasion Visākhā took a washcloth and went to the Buddha. She bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd8:18.1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho visākhā migāramātā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd8:18.1.3.pli: “paṭiggaṇhātu me, bhante, bhagavā mukhapuñchanacoḷaṃ, yaṃ mamassa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:18.1.3.eng: “Sir, please accept this washcloth for my long-lasting benefit and happiness.”

pli-tv-kd8:18.1.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā visākhaṃ migāramātaraṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd8:18.1.5.eng: and then instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching.

pli-tv-kd8:18.1.6.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd8:18.1.6.eng: She got up from her seat, bowed down, circumambulated him with her right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd8:18.1.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd8:18.1.7.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd8:19.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rojo mallo āyasmato ānandassa sahāyo hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:19.1.1.eng: At that time Venerable Ānanda had a friend called Roja the Mallian.

pli-tv-kd8:19.1.2.pli: Rojassa mallassa khomapilotikā āyasmato ānandassa hatthe nikkhittā hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:19.1.2.eng: Roja had left an old linen cloth with Ānanda,

pli-tv-kd8:19.1.3.pli: Āyasmato ca ānandassa khomapilotikāya attho hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:19.1.3.eng: and it so happened that Ānanda needed such a cloth.

pli-tv-kd8:19.1.5.eng: “I allow you to take things on trust from someone who has five qualities:

pli-tv-kd8:19.1.6.pli: sandiṭṭho ca hoti, sambhatto ca, ālapito ca, jīvati ca, jānāti ca—gahite me attamano bhavissatīti.
pli-tv-kd8:19.1.6.eng: they’re a friend, they’re a close companion, they’ve spoken about it, they’re alive, and you know they’ll be pleased if you take it.”

pli-tv-kd8:19.1.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imehi pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa vissāsaṃ gahetun”ti.

pli-tv-kd8:20.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhūnaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ hoti ticīvaraṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:20.1.1.eng: At that time the monks had enough robes,

pli-tv-kd8:20.1.2.eng: but they needed water filters and bags.

pli-tv-kd8:20.2.0.eng: 20. Discussion of the smallest robe-cloth that can be assigned to another, etc.

pli-tv-kd8:20.2.2.pli: “yāni tāni bhagavatā anuññātāni ticīvaranti vā vassikasāṭikāti vā nisīdananti vā paccattharaṇanti vā kaṇḍuppaṭicchādīti vā mukhapuñchanacoḷanti vā parikkhāracoḷanti vā, sabbāni tāni adhiṭṭhātabbāni nu kho, udāhu vikappetabbānī”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:20.2.2.eng: “These things that have been allowed by the Buddha—the three robes, the rainy-season robe, the sitting mat, the sheet, the itch-covering cloth, the washcloth, and the cloth for requisites—are they all to be determined or to be assigned to another?”

pli-tv-kd8:20.2.4.eng: “You should determine the three robes, not assign them to another;

pli-tv-kd8:20.2.5.pli: vassikasāṭikaṃ vassānaṃ cātumāsaṃ adhiṭṭhātuṃ, tato paraṃ vikappetuṃ;
pli-tv-kd8:20.2.5.eng: you should determine the rainy-season robe for the four months of the rainy season, and apart from that assign it to another;

pli-tv-kd8:20.2.6.eng: you should determine the sitting mat, not assign it to another;

pli-tv-kd8:20.2.7.eng: you should determine a sheet, not assign it to another;

pli-tv-kd8:20.2.8.pli: kaṇḍuppaṭicchādiṃ yāva ābādhā adhiṭṭhātuṃ tato paraṃ vikappetuṃ;
pli-tv-kd8:20.2.8.eng: you should determine an itch-covering cloth for as long as you’re sick, and apart from that assign it to another;

pli-tv-kd8:20.2.9.eng: you should determine a washcloth, not assign it to another;

pli-tv-kd8:20.2.10.eng: you should determine a cloth for requisites, not assign it to another.”

pli-tv-kd8:21.1.2.eng: “What’s the size of the smallest robe-cloth that can be assigned to another?”

pli-tv-kd8:21.1.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, āyāmena aṭṭhaṅgulaṃ sugataṅgulena caturaṅgulavitthataṃ pacchimaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:21.1.4.eng: “The smallest robe-cloth you should assign to another is one that’s eight standard fingerbreadths long and four wide.”

pli-tv-kd8:21.1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato mahākassapassa paṃsukūlakato garuko hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:21.1.5.eng: At that time Venerable Mahākassapa’s rag robes were heavy.

pli-tv-kd8:21.1.7.eng: “I allow you to mend roughly with thread.”
pli-tv-kd8:21.1.7.comm: Sp 3.359: Suttalūkhaṁ kātunti sutteneva aggaḷaṁ kātunti attho, “Suttalūkhaṁ kātuṁ means to patch just using thread.”

pli-tv-kd8:21.1.8.comm: Sp 3.359: Vikaṇṇo hotīti suttaṁ acchetvā acchetvā sibbantānaṁ eko saṅghāṭikoṇo dīgho hoti, “Vikaṇṇo hoti: when those who are sewing repeatedly pull (añchitvā añchitvā) the thread, one corner of the outer robe becomes long.” Here, instead of reading acchetvā acchetvā (“having repeatedly left uncut”), which does not fit the context well, I read añchitvā añchitvā with Sp-yoj 3.359.

pli-tv-kd8:21.1.10.eng: “I allow you to remove the deformity.”
pli-tv-kd8:21.1.10.comm: Sp 3.359: Vikaṇṇaṁ uddharitunti dīghakoṇaṁ chindituṁ, “Vikaṇṇaṁ uddharituṁ means to cut off the long corner.”

pli-tv-kd8:21.1.13.eng: “I allow you to add a lengthwise border and a crosswise border.”
pli-tv-kd8:21.1.13.comm: Anuvāta and paribhaṇḍa, refer to long and short borders respectively. This is what the commentaries have to say. Sp 3.308: Anuvātakaraṇamattenāti piṭṭhianuvātāropanamattena, “Anuvātakaraṇamattena means merely by mounting a border at the back.” Which is further explained at Sp-ṭ 3.308: Piṭṭhianuvātāropanamattenāti dīghato anuvātassa āropanamattena, “Piṭṭhianuvātāropanamattena means merely by mounting a border lengthwise.” Sp 3.308: Paribhaṇḍakaraṇamattenāti kucchianauvātāropanamattena, “Paribhaṇḍakaraṇamattena means merely by mounting a border at the belly.” Which is further explained at Sp-ṭ 3.308: Kucchianuvātāropanamattenāti puthulato anuvātassa āropanamattena, “Kucchianuvātāropanamattena means merely by adding a border crosswise.”

pli-tv-kd8:21.1.14.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghāṭiyā pattā lujjanti.
pli-tv-kd8:21.1.14.eng: On one occasion the panels of an outer robe were breaking up.

pli-tv-kd8:21.1.16.comm: Sp 3.359: Aṭṭhapadakaṁ kātunti aṭṭhapadakacchannena pattamukhaṁ sibbituṁ, “Aṭṭhapadakaṁ kātuṁ means to sew the opening in the panel with a network-covering.” CPD suggests “network” for aṭṭhapadaka.

pli-tv-kd8:21.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno ticīvare kayiramāne sabbaṃ chinnakaṃ nappahoti.
pli-tv-kd8:21.2.1.eng: At one time, while making a set of three robes for a monk, there was not enough cloth to make all three out of pieces.

pli-tv-kd8:21.2.3.eng: “I allow two robes made of pieces and one that isn’t.”

pli-tv-kd8:21.2.4.eng: There was not enough cloth to make two out of pieces.

pli-tv-kd8:21.2.6.eng: “I allow one robe made of pieces and two that are not.”

pli-tv-kd8:21.2.7.eng: There was not enough cloth to make one out of pieces.

pli-tv-kd8:21.2.9.eng: “I allow you to add a further supply.
pli-tv-kd8:21.2.9.comm: Sp 3.360: Anvādhikampi āropetunti āgantukapattampi dātuṁ, “Anvādhikampi āropetuṁ: to give an extra panel.” The exact significance of this is unclear.

pli-tv-kd8:21.2.10.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, sabbaṃ acchinnakaṃ dhāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:21.2.10.eng: But you shouldn’t wear robes none of which are cut into pieces.

pli-tv-kd8:21.2.11.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd8:22.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno bahuṃ cīvaraṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:22.1.1.eng: On one occasion a monk who had been given much robe-cloth

pli-tv-kd8:22.1.2.pli: So ca taṃ cīvaraṃ mātāpitūnaṃ dātukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:22.1.2.eng: wanted to give it to his mother and father.

pli-tv-kd8:22.1.4.eng: “If you’re giving to your mother and father, what can I say?

pli-tv-kd8:22.1.5.eng: I allow you to give to your mother and father.

pli-tv-kd8:22.1.6.eng: But, monks, a gift of faith shouldn’t be ruined.
pli-tv-kd8:22.1.6.comm: Sp 3.361: Ettha sesañātīnaṁ dento vinipātetiyeva, “In this context it goes to ruin when given to other relatives.” Presumably this means one should not give to anyone who is not a monastic, apart from one’s parents.

pli-tv-kd8:22.1.7.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd8:23.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu andhavane cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd8:23.1.1.eng: On one occasion a monk left one of his robes in the Blind Men’s Grove and then entered the village for alms in just his sarong and upper robe.

pli-tv-kd8:23.1.3.eng: and as a result he became poorly dressed.

pli-tv-kd8:23.1.4.eng: When other monks asked him why,

pli-tv-kd8:23.1.6.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, andhavane cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisiṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:23.1.6.eng: he told them what had happened.

pli-tv-kd8:23.1.10.eng: “You shouldn’t enter a village in just your sarong and upper robe.

pli-tv-kd8:23.1.11.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd8:23.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ānando assatiyā santaruttarena gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd8:23.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards Venerable Ānanda, being absentminded, entered a village in just his sarong and upper robe.

pli-tv-kd8:23.2.3.eng: “Hasn’t the Buddha laid down a rule against entering the village in just a sarong and an upper robe?”

pli-tv-kd8:23.2.5.pli: Kissa tvaṃ, āvuso ānanda, santaruttarena gāmaṃ paviṭṭho”ti?

pli-tv-kd8:23.2.6.eng: Ānanda told them what had happened.

pli-tv-kd8:23.3.1.eng: “There are five reasons for leaving behind the outer robe, the upper robe, or the sarong:
pli-tv-kd8:23.3.1.comm: This passage suggests that each of the three robes could be used as a substitute for the remaining two, which in turn suggests they were similar to each other.

pli-tv-kd8:23.3.2.pli: gilāno vā hoti, vassikasaṅketaṃ vā hoti, nadīpāraṃ gantuṃ vā hoti, aggaḷaguttivihāro vā hoti, atthatakathinaṃ vā hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:23.3.2.eng: you’re sick; it’s the rainy season; you’re going to cross a river; the dwelling is protected by a door; you have participated in the robe-making ceremony.
pli-tv-kd8:23.3.2.comm: Sp 3.362: Vassikasaṅketanti vassike cattāro māse, “Vassikasaṅketa means the four months of the rainy season.” “Door” renders aggaḷa. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd8:23.3.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca paccayā saṅghāṭiyā nikkhepāya.

pli-tv-kd8:23.3.6.pli: gilāno vā hoti, vassikasaṅketaṃ vā hoti, nadīpāraṃ gantuṃ vā hoti, aggaḷaguttivihāro vā hoti, atthatakathinaṃ vā hoti.

pli-tv-kd8:23.3.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca paccayā uttarāsaṅgassa antaravāsakassa nikkhepāya.

pli-tv-kd8:23.3.8.eng: There are five reasons for leaving behind the rainy-season robe:

pli-tv-kd8:23.3.9.pli: gilāno vā hoti, nissīmaṃ gantuṃ vā hoti, nadīpāraṃ gantuṃ vā hoti, aggaḷaguttivihāro vā hoti, vassikasāṭikā akatā vā hoti vippakatā vā.
pli-tv-kd8:23.3.9.eng: you’re sick; you’re going outside the monastery zone; you’re going to cross a river; the dwelling is protected by a door; the rainy-season robe hasn’t been sewn or is unfinished.”

pli-tv-kd8:23.3.10.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca paccayā vassikasāṭikāya nikkhepāyā”ti.

pli-tv-kd8:24.1.0.eng: 21. Discussion of robe-cloth given to the Sangha

pli-tv-kd8:24.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu eko vassaṃ vasi.
pli-tv-kd8:24.1.1.eng: At that time a certain monk had spent the rainy season by himself.

pli-tv-kd8:24.1.2.pli: Tattha manussā saṅghassa demāti cīvarāni adaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd8:24.1.2.eng: People gave him robe-cloth, intending it for the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd8:24.1.5.eng: that a sangha consists of a group of at least four,

pli-tv-kd8:24.1.7.pli: Ime ca manussā saṅghassa demāti cīvarāni adaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd8:24.1.7.eng: Now these people have given robe-cloth, intending it for the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd8:24.1.8.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ imāni saṅghikāni cīvarāni sāvatthiṃ hareyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.1.8.eng: Let me take it to Sāvatthī.”

pli-tv-kd8:24.1.9.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu tāni cīvarāni ādāya sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd8:24.1.9.eng: He then took that robe-cloth to Sāvatthī and told the Buddha what had happened.

pli-tv-kd8:24.1.10.pli: “Tuyheva, bhikkhu, tāni cīvarāni yāva kathinassa ubbhārāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.1.10.eng: The Buddha said, “This robe-cloth is yours until the end of the robe season.

pli-tv-kd8:24.2.1.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu eko vassaṃ vasati.
pli-tv-kd8:24.2.1.eng: It may be that a monk spends the rainy season by himself,

pli-tv-kd8:24.2.4.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tasseva tāni cīvarāni yāva kathinassa ubbhārāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.2.4.eng: That robe-cloth is his until the end of the robe season.”

pli-tv-kd8:24.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu utukālaṃ eko vasi.
pli-tv-kd8:24.3.1.eng: At one time a certain monk was living by himself outside the rainy season.

pli-tv-kd8:24.3.2.pli: Tattha manussā saṅghassa demāti cīvarāni adaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd8:24.3.2.eng: People gave him robe-cloth, intending it for the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd8:24.3.5.eng: that a sangha consists of a group of at least four,

pli-tv-kd8:24.3.7.eng: Now these people have given robe-cloth,

pli-tv-kd8:24.3.9.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ imāni saṅghikāni cīvarāni sāvatthiṃ hareyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.3.9.eng: Let me take it to Sāvatthī.”

pli-tv-kd8:24.3.10.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu tāni cīvarāni ādāya sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd8:24.3.10.eng: He then took that robe-cloth to Sāvatthī and told the monks,

pli-tv-kd8:24.3.11.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd8:24.3.12.eng: He said, “The present Sangha should distribute it.

pli-tv-kd8:24.4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu utukālaṃ eko vasati. Tattha manussā—‘saṅghassa demā’ti cīvarāni denti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.4.1.eng: It may be that a monk is living by himself outside the rainy season, yet people give him robe-cloth, intending it for the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd8:24.4.2.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tena bhikkhunā tāni cīvarāni adhiṭṭhātuṃ—‘mayhimāni cīvarānī’ti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.4.2.eng: I allow that monk to determine that robe-cloth as his.

pli-tv-kd8:24.4.3.pli: Tassa ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno taṃ cīvaraṃ anadhiṭṭhite añño bhikkhu āgacchati, samako dātabbo bhāgo.
pli-tv-kd8:24.4.3.eng: But if another monk arrives before he has determined that robe-cloth, then he should be given an equal share.

pli-tv-kd8:24.4.4.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi taṃ cīvaraṃ bhājiyamāne, apātite kuse, añño bhikkhu āgacchati, samako dātabbo bhāgo.
pli-tv-kd8:24.4.4.eng: If yet another monk arrives before they’ve distributed that robe-cloth by drawing lots, he too should be given an equal share.

pli-tv-kd8:24.4.5.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi taṃ cīvaraṃ bhājiyamāne, pātite kuse, añño bhikkhu āgacchati, nākāmā dātabbo bhāgo”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.4.5.eng: If still another monk arrives, but after they’ve distributed that robe-cloth by drawing lots, they don’t need to give him a share if they’re unwilling.”

pli-tv-kd8:24.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dve bhātikā therā, āyasmā ca isidāso āyasmā ca isibhaṭo, sāvatthiyaṃ vassaṃvuṭṭhā aññataraṃ gāmakāvāsaṃ agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd8:24.5.1.eng: On one occasion, after completing the rainy-season residence at Sāvatthī, two senior monks who were brothers, Venerable Isidāsa and Venerable Isibhaṭa, went to a certain village monastery.

pli-tv-kd8:24.5.2.eng: Because it was a long time since they had been there, people gave meals together with robe-cloth.

pli-tv-kd8:24.5.3.pli: Āvāsikā bhikkhū there pucchiṃsu—“imāni, bhante, saṅghikāni cīvarāni there āgamma uppannāni, sādiyissanti therā bhāgan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.5.3.eng: The resident monks asked them, “Venerables, this robe-cloth belonging to the Sangha was given because of you. Will you accept a share?”

pli-tv-kd8:24.5.4.pli: Therā evamāhaṃsu—“yathā kho mayaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāma, tumhākaṃyeva tāni cīvarāni yāva kathinassa ubbhārāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.5.4.eng: They replied, “As we understand the teaching of the Buddha, this robe-cloth is just for you until the end of the robe season.”

pli-tv-kd8:24.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tayo bhikkhū rājagahe vassaṃ vasanti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.6.1.eng: At that time there were three monks who were spending the rains residence at Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd8:24.6.2.pli: Tattha manussā saṅghassa demāti cīvarāni denti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.6.2.eng: People gave them robe-cloth, intending it for the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd8:24.6.3.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—“bhagavatā paññattaṃ—‘catuvaggo pacchimo saṅgho’ti. Mayañcamhā tayo janā.
pli-tv-kd8:24.6.3.eng: The monks considered, “The Buddha has laid down that a sangha consists of a group of at least four, but we’re just three.

pli-tv-kd8:24.6.4.pli: Ime ca manussā saṅghassa demāti cīvarāni denti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.6.4.eng: Now these people have given robe-cloth, intending it for the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd8:24.6.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā therā, āyasmā ca nilavāsī āyasmā ca sāṇavāsī āyasmā ca gotako āyasmā ca bhagu āyasmā ca phaḷikasantāno, pāṭaliputte viharanti kukkuṭārāme.
pli-tv-kd8:24.6.6.eng: On that occasion there were a number of senior monks—Venerable Nilavāsī, Venerable Sāṇavāsī, Venerable Gotaka, Venerable Bhagu, and Venerable Phaḷikasantāna—staying at Pāṭaliputta in the Kukkuṭa Monastery.

pli-tv-kd8:24.6.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū pāṭaliputtaṃ gantvā there pucchiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd8:24.6.7.eng: The monks from Rājagaha went to Pāṭaliputta to ask them.

pli-tv-kd8:24.6.9.pli: “yathā kho mayaṃ āvuso bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāma, tumhākaṃyeva tāni cīvarāni yāva kathinassa ubbhārāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:24.6.9.eng: “As we understand the teaching of the Buddha, that robe-cloth is just for you until the end of the robe season.”

pli-tv-kd8:25.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto sāvatthiyaṃ vassaṃvuṭṭho aññataraṃ gāmakāvāsaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd8:25.1.1.eng: At one time, after completing the rainy-season residence at Sāvatthī, Venerable Upananda the Sakyan went to a certain village monastery.

pli-tv-kd8:25.1.2.pli: Tattha ca bhikkhū cīvaraṃ bhājetukāmā sannipatiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd8:25.1.2.eng: Just then the monks there had gathered to distribute the robe-cloth.

pli-tv-kd8:25.1.3.pli: Te evamāhaṃsu—“imāni kho, āvuso, saṅghikāni cīvarāni bhājiyissanti, sādiyissasi bhāgan”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:25.1.3.eng: They said to Upananda, “We’re distributing the Sangha’s robe-cloth. Would you like a share?”

pli-tv-kd8:25.1.5.pli: Tato cīvarabhāgaṃ gahetvā aññaṃ āvāsaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd8:25.1.5.eng: He then took that share of robe-cloth and went to another monastery.

pli-tv-kd8:25.1.6.eng: There, too, the monks had gathered to distribute the robe-cloth.

pli-tv-kd8:25.1.7.pli: Tepi evamāhaṃsu—“imāni kho, āvuso, saṅghikāni cīvarāni bhājiyissanti, sādiyissasi bhāgan”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:25.1.7.eng: They said to Upananda, “We’re distributing the Sangha’s robe-cloth. Would you like a share?”

pli-tv-kd8:25.1.9.pli: Tatopi cīvarabhāgaṃ gahetvā aññaṃ āvāsaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd8:25.1.9.eng: He then took that share, too, and went to yet another monastery.

pli-tv-kd8:25.1.10.eng: There, too, the monks had gathered to distribute the robe-cloth.

pli-tv-kd8:25.1.11.pli: Tepi evamāhaṃsu—“imāni kho, āvuso, saṅghikāni cīvarāni bhājiyissanti, sādiyissasi bhāgan”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:25.1.11.eng: They said to Upananda, “We’re distributing the Sangha’s robe-cloth. Would you like a share?”

pli-tv-kd8:25.1.13.pli: Tatopi cīvarabhāgaṃ gahetvā mahantaṃ cīvarabhaṇḍikaṃ ādāya punadeva sāvatthiṃ paccāgañchi.
pli-tv-kd8:25.1.13.eng: He then took that share too, made a large bundle of robe-cloth, and returned to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd8:25.2.1.pli: Bhikkhū evamāhaṃsu—“mahāpuññosi tvaṃ, āvuso upananda, bahuṃ te cīvaraṃ uppannan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:25.2.1.eng: The monks said to him, “You have much merit, Upananda, as you’ve been given so much robe-cloth.”

pli-tv-kd8:25.2.2.eng: “This has nothing to do with merit.”

pli-tv-kd8:25.2.3.pli: Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, sāvatthiyaṃ vassaṃvuṭṭho aññataraṃ gāmakāvāsaṃ agamāsiṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:25.2.3.eng: And he told them how he had obtained so much robe-cloth.

pli-tv-kd8:25.2.5.pli: Te maṃ evamāhaṃsu—‘imāni kho, āvuso, saṅghikāni cīvarāni bhājiyissanti, sādiyissasi bhāgan’ti?

pli-tv-kd8:25.2.7.pli: Tato cīvarabhāgaṃ gahetvā aññaṃ āvāsaṃ agamāsiṃ.

pli-tv-kd8:25.2.9.pli: Tepi maṃ evamāhaṃsu—‘imāni kho, āvuso, saṅghikāni cīvarāni bhājiyissanti, sādiyissasi bhāgan’ti?

pli-tv-kd8:25.2.11.pli: Tatopi cīvarabhāgaṃ gahetvā aññaṃ āvāsaṃ agamāsiṃ.

pli-tv-kd8:25.2.13.pli: Tepi maṃ evamāhaṃsu—‘imāni kho, āvuso, saṅghikāni cīvarāni bhājiyissanti, sādiyissasi bhāgan’ti?

pli-tv-kd8:25.3.1.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, āvuso upananda, aññatra vassaṃvuṭṭho aññatra cīvarabhāgaṃ sādiyī”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:25.3.1.eng: “So you spent the rains residence in one place and accepted a share of the robe-cloth from somewhere else?”

pli-tv-kd8:25.3.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd8:25.3.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,

pli-tv-kd8:25.3.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto aññatra vassaṃvuṭṭho aññatra cīvarabhāgaṃ sādiyissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:25.3.4.eng: “How could Venerable Upananda spend the rains residence in one place and then accept a share of the robe-cloth from somewhere else?”

pli-tv-kd8:25.3.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, aññatra vassaṃvuṭṭho aññatra cīvarabhāgaṃ sādiyī”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:25.3.6.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

pli-tv-kd8:25.3.9.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, aññatra vassaṃvuṭṭho aññatra cīvarabhāgaṃ sādiyissasi.
pli-tv-kd8:25.3.9.eng: “Foolish man, how could you spend the rains residence in one place and then accept a share of the robe-cloth from somewhere else?

pli-tv-kd8:25.3.12.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd8:25.3.13.pli: “na, bhikkhave, aññatra vassaṃvuṭṭhena aññatra cīvarabhāgo sāditabbo.
pli-tv-kd8:25.3.13.eng: “You shouldn’t spend the rainy-season residence in one place and then accept a share of the robe-cloth from somewhere else.

pli-tv-kd8:25.3.14.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd8:25.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto eko dvīsu āvāsesu vassaṃ vasi—“evaṃ me bahuṃ cīvaraṃ uppajjissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:25.4.1.eng: At one time Venerable Upananda spent the rains residence in two separate monasteries, thinking, “In this way I’ll get much robe-cloth.”

pli-tv-kd8:25.4.2.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—“kathaṃ nu kho āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa cīvarapaṭivīso dātabbo”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:25.4.2.eng: The monks thought, “What share of the robe-cloth should be given to Venerable Upananda?”

pli-tv-kd8:25.4.4.eng: “Give the foolish man one person’s share.

pli-tv-kd8:25.4.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu eko dvīsu āvāsesu vassaṃ vasati—‘evaṃ me bahuṃ cīvaraṃ uppajjissatī’ti.
pli-tv-kd8:25.4.5.eng: It may be that a monk spends the rains residence in two monasteries with the intention of getting much robe-cloth.

pli-tv-kd8:25.4.6.pli: Sace amutra upaḍḍhaṃ amutra upaḍḍhaṃ vasati, amutra upaḍḍho amutra upaḍḍho cīvarapaṭivīso dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd8:25.4.6.eng: If he spends half the time in each monastery, he should be given half a share of the robe-cloth in each.

pli-tv-kd8:25.4.7.pli: Yattha vā pana bahutaraṃ vasati, tato cīvarapaṭivīso dātabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:25.4.7.eng: Otherwise he should be given his share of the robe-cloth in the monastery where he spends the most time.”

pli-tv-kd8:26.1.0.eng: 23. The account of the one who was sick

pli-tv-kd8:26.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno kucchivikārābādho hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:26.1.1.eng: On one occasion there was a monk who had dysentery

pli-tv-kd8:26.1.2.eng: and was lying in his own feces and urine.

pli-tv-kd8:26.1.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmatā ānandena pacchāsamaṇena senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍanto yena tassa bhikkhuno vihāro tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd8:26.1.3.eng: Just then, as the Buddha was walking about the dwellings with Venerable Ānanda as his attendant, he came to the dwelling of this monk.

pli-tv-kd8:26.1.4.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā taṃ bhikkhuṃ sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ sayamānaṃ, disvāna yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd8:26.1.4.eng: When he saw his condition, he went up to him and said,

pli-tv-kd8:26.1.10.eng: “Because I don’t do anything for them.”

pli-tv-kd8:26.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—

pli-tv-kd8:26.2.2.eng: “Go and get some water, Ānanda. Let’s give him a wash.”

pli-tv-kd8:26.2.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā udakaṃ āhari.
pli-tv-kd8:26.2.3.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he did just that.

pli-tv-kd8:26.2.4.eng: And so the Buddha poured the water,

pli-tv-kd8:26.2.6.eng: Then, the Buddha lifting him by the head

pli-tv-kd8:26.2.7.pli: Āyasmā ānando pādato uccāretvā mañcake nipātesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:26.2.7.eng: and Ānanda by the feet, they lay him on a bed.

pli-tv-kd8:26.3.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd8:26.3.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd8:26.3.2.eng: “Is there a sick monk in that dwelling?”

pli-tv-kd8:26.3.9.eng: “Because he doesn’t do anything for us.”

pli-tv-kd8:26.3.11.pli: “Natthi vo, bhikkhave, mātā, natthi pitā, ye vo upaṭṭhaheyyuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:26.3.11.eng: “Monks, you have no mother or father to nurse you.

pli-tv-kd8:26.3.12.pli: Tumhe ce, bhikkhave, aññamaññaṃ na upaṭṭhahissatha, atha ko carahi upaṭṭhahissati?
pli-tv-kd8:26.3.12.eng: If you don’t nurse one another, who will?

pli-tv-kd8:26.3.13.pli: Yo, bhikkhave, maṃ upaṭṭhaheyya so gilānaṃ upaṭṭhaheyya.
pli-tv-kd8:26.3.13.eng: Whoever would nurse me should nurse one who is sick.

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyo hoti, upajjhāyena yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo;
pli-tv-kd8:26.4.1.eng: If you have a preceptor, he should nurse you for life;

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.2.eng: he shouldn’t go anywhere until you’ve recovered.

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.3.pli: Sace ācariyo hoti, ācariyena yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo;
pli-tv-kd8:26.4.3.eng: If you have a teacher, he should nurse you for life;

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.4.eng: he shouldn’t go anywhere until you’ve recovered.

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.5.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko hoti, saddhivihārikena yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo;
pli-tv-kd8:26.4.5.eng: If you have a student, he should nurse you for life;

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.6.eng: he shouldn’t go anywhere until you’ve recovered.

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.7.pli: Sace antevāsiko hoti, antevāsikena yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo;
pli-tv-kd8:26.4.7.eng: If you have a pupil, he should nurse you for life;

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.8.eng: he shouldn’t go anywhere until you’ve recovered.

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.9.pli: Sace samānupajjhāyako hoti, samānupajjhāyakena yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo;
pli-tv-kd8:26.4.9.eng: If you have a co-student, he should nurse you for life;

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.10.eng: he shouldn’t go anywhere until you’ve recovered.

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.11.pli: Sace samānācariyako hoti, samānācariyakena yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo;
pli-tv-kd8:26.4.11.eng: If you have a co-pupil, he should nurse you for life;

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.12.eng: he shouldn’t go anywhere until you’ve recovered.

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.13.pli: Sace na hoti upajjhāyo vā ācariyo vā saddhivihāriko vā antevāsiko vā samānupajjhāyako vā samānācariyako vā saṅghena upaṭṭhātabbo.
pli-tv-kd8:26.4.13.eng: If you have none of these, the Sangha should nurse you.

pli-tv-kd8:26.4.14.eng: If you don’t nurse one who is sick, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd8:26.5.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato gilāno dūpaṭṭho hoti—
pli-tv-kd8:26.5.1.eng: “A sick person who has five qualities is hard to nurse:

pli-tv-kd8:26.5.2.pli: asappāyakārī hoti, sappāye mattaṃ na jānāti, bhesajjaṃ na paṭisevitā hoti, atthakāmassa gilānupaṭṭhākassa yathābhūtaṃ ābādhaṃ nāvikattā hoti ‘abhikkamantaṃ vā abhikkamatīti, paṭikkamantaṃ vā paṭikkamatīti, ṭhitaṃ vā ṭhito’ti, uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ anadhivāsakajātiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:26.5.2.eng: they do what’s detrimental for curing the sickness; they don’t know the right amount in what’s beneficial; they don’t take their medicine; they don’t accurately describe the state of their illness—whether it’s getting worse, better, or remaining the same—to the one who’s nursing them and wishing them well; they’re unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and life-threatening.

pli-tv-kd8:26.5.3.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato gilāno dūpaṭṭho hoti.

pli-tv-kd8:26.6.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato gilāno sūpaṭṭho hoti—
pli-tv-kd8:26.6.1.eng: A sick person who has five qualities is easy to nurse:

pli-tv-kd8:26.6.2.pli: sappāyakārī hoti, sappāye mattaṃ jānāti, bhesajjaṃ paṭisevitā hoti, atthakāmassa gilānupaṭṭhākassa yathābhūtaṃ ābādhaṃ āvikattā hoti ‘abhikkamantaṃ vā abhikkamatīti, paṭikkamantaṃ vā paṭikkamatīti, ṭhitaṃ vā ṭhito’ti, uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsakajātiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:26.6.2.eng: they do what’s beneficial for curing the sickness; they know the right amount in what’s beneficial; they take their medicine; they accurately describe the state of their illness—whether it’s getting worse, better, or remaining the same—to the one who’s nursing them and wishing them well; they’re able to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and life-threatening.

pli-tv-kd8:26.6.3.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato gilāno sūpaṭṭho hoti.

pli-tv-kd8:26.7.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato gilānupaṭṭhāko nālaṃ gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ—
pli-tv-kd8:26.7.1.eng: An attendant who has five qualities is unsuited to nurse the sick:

pli-tv-kd8:26.7.2.pli: na paṭibalo hoti bhesajjaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ, sappāyāsappāyaṃ na jānāti, asappāyaṃ upanāmeti sappāyaṃ apanāmeti, āmisantaro gilānaṃ upaṭṭhāti no mettacitto, jegucchī hoti uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā vantaṃ vā nīhātuṃ, na paṭibalo hoti gilānaṃ kālena kālaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetuṃ samādapetuṃ samuttejetuṃ sampahaṃsetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:26.7.2.eng: they’re incapable of preparing medicine; not knowing what’s beneficial and what’s harmful, they bring what’s harmful and remove what’s beneficial; they nurse the sick for the sake of worldly gain, not with a mind of good will; they’re disgusted at having to clean up feces, urine, spit, or vomit; they’re incapable of instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the sick person with a teaching from time to time.
pli-tv-kd8:26.7.2.comm: Sp 3.366: Bhesajjaṁ saṁvidhātunti bhesajjaṁ yojetuṁ asamattho hoti, “Bhesajjaṁ saṁvidhātuṁ: he is incapable of preparing medicine.”

pli-tv-kd8:26.7.3.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato gilānupaṭṭhāko nālaṃ gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ.

pli-tv-kd8:26.8.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato gilānupaṭṭhāko alaṃ gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ—
pli-tv-kd8:26.8.1.eng: An attendant who has five qualities is suited to nurse the sick:

pli-tv-kd8:26.8.2.pli: paṭibalo hoti bhesajjaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ, sappāyāsappāyaṃ jānāti, asappāyaṃ apanāmeti sappāyaṃ upanāmeti, mettacitto gilānaṃ upaṭṭhāti no āmisantaro, ajegucchī hoti uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā vantaṃ vā nīhātuṃ, paṭibalo hoti gilānaṃ kālena kālaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetuṃ samādapetuṃ samuttejetuṃ sampahaṃsetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:26.8.2.eng: they’re capable of preparing medicine; knowing what’s beneficial and what’s harmful, they remove what’s harmful and bring what’s beneficial; they nurse the sick with a mind of good will, not for the sake of worldly gain; they’re not disgusted at having to clean up feces, urine, spit, or vomit; they’re capable of instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the sick person with a teaching from time to time.”

pli-tv-kd8:26.8.3.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato gilānupaṭṭhāko alaṃ gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātun”ti.

pli-tv-kd8:27.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū kosalesu janapade addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti.
pli-tv-kd8:27.1.1.eng: On one occasion two monks were traveling through the Kosalan country,

pli-tv-kd8:27.1.2.eng: when they arrived at a monastery

pli-tv-kd8:27.1.5.eng: “The Buddha has praised nursing the sick,

pli-tv-kd8:27.1.6.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, imaṃ bhikkhuṃ upaṭṭhahemā”ti.

pli-tv-kd8:27.1.8.eng: But while they were nursing him, he died.

pli-tv-kd8:27.1.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū tassa bhikkhuno pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:27.1.9.eng: They then took his bowl and robes and went to Sāvatthī, where they told the Buddha what had happened.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.1.eng: “When a monk dies, the Sangha becomes the owner of his bowl and robes.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.2.eng: Still, the nurses have been very helpful.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.3.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, saṅghena ticīvarañca pattañca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:27.2.3.eng: I allow the Sangha to give the three robes and the bowl to the nurses.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.4.eng: And they should be given like this.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.5.pli: Tena gilānupaṭṭhākena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd8:27.2.5.eng: The monk nurse should approach the Sangha and say,

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.7.eng: Here are his three robes and bowl.’

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.8.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.9.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.11.eng: Here are his three robes and bowl.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.12.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ ticīvarañca pattañca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-kd8:27.2.12.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give the three robes and the bowl to the nurses.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.14.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.16.eng: Here are his three robes and bowl.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.17.pli: Saṅgho imaṃ ticīvarañca pattañca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ deti.
pli-tv-kd8:27.2.17.eng: The Sangha gives the three robes and the bowl to the nurses.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.18.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati imassa ticīvarassa ca pattassa ca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ dānaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd8:27.2.18.eng: Any monk who approves of giving the three robes and the bowl to the nurses should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.19.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.20.pli: Dinnaṃ idaṃ saṅghena ticīvarañca patto ca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:27.2.20.eng: The Sangha has given the three robes and the bowl to the nurses.

pli-tv-kd8:27.2.21.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:27.2.21.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro sāmaṇero kālaṅkato hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:27.3.1.eng: On one occasion a novice monk had died.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.3.eng: “When a novice monk dies, the Sangha becomes the owner of his bowl and robes.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.4.eng: Still, the nurses have been very helpful.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, saṅghena cīvarañca pattañca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:27.3.5.eng: I allow the Sangha to give the robes and the bowl to the nurses.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.6.eng: And they should be given like this.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.7.pli: Tena gilānupaṭṭhākena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd8:27.3.7.eng: The monk nurse should approach the Sangha and say,

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.8.pli: ‘itthannāmo, bhante, sāmaṇero kālaṅkato, idaṃ tassa cīvarañca patto cā’ti.
pli-tv-kd8:27.3.8.eng: ‘Venerables, the novice monk so-and-so has died. Here are his robes and bowl.’

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.9.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.10.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.11.eng: The novice monk so-and-so has died.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.12.eng: Here are his robes and bowl.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.13.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ cīvarañca pattañca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-kd8:27.3.13.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give the robes and the bowl to the nurses.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.15.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.16.eng: The novice monk so-and-so has died.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.17.eng: Here are his robes and bowl.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.18.pli: Saṅgho imaṃ cīvarañca pattañca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ deti.
pli-tv-kd8:27.3.18.eng: The Sangha gives the robes and the bowl to the nurses.
