pli-tv-kd8:27.3.19.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati imassa cīvarassa ca pattassa ca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ dānaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd8:27.3.19.eng: Any monk who approves of giving the robes and the bowl to the nurses should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.20.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.21.pli: Dinnaṃ idaṃ saṅghena cīvarañca patto ca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:27.3.21.eng: The Sangha has given the robes and the bowl to the nurses.

pli-tv-kd8:27.3.22.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:27.3.22.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd8:27.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu ca sāmaṇero ca gilānaṃ upaṭṭhahiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd8:27.4.1.eng: On one occasion a monk and a novice monk were nursing someone together.

pli-tv-kd8:27.4.2.eng: While they were doing so, the patient died.

pli-tv-kd8:27.4.3.pli: Atha kho tassa gilānupaṭṭhākassa bhikkhuno etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd8:27.4.4.pli: “kathaṃ nu kho gilānupaṭṭhākassa sāmaṇerassa cīvarapaṭivīso dātabbo”ti?
pli-tv-kd8:27.4.4.eng: “What share of the robes should be given to the novice-monk nurse?”

pli-tv-kd8:27.4.6.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānupaṭṭhākassa sāmaṇerassa samakaṃ paṭivīsaṃ dātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:27.4.6.eng: “I allow you to give an equal share to the novice-monk nurse.”

pli-tv-kd8:27.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu bahubhaṇḍo bahuparikkhāro kālaṅkato hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:27.5.1.eng: On one occasion a monk with many possessions had died.

pli-tv-kd8:27.5.3.eng: “When a monk dies, the Sangha becomes the owner of his bowl and robes.

pli-tv-kd8:27.5.4.eng: Still, the nurses have been very helpful.

pli-tv-kd8:27.5.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, saṅghena ticīvarañca pattañca gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:27.5.5.eng: I allow the Sangha to give the three robes and the bowl to the nurses.

pli-tv-kd8:27.5.6.pli: Yaṃ tattha lahubhaṇḍaṃ lahuparikkhāraṃ taṃ sammukhībhūtena saṅghena bhājetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:27.5.6.eng: The present Sangha should distribute his ordinary possessions.
pli-tv-kd8:27.5.6.comm: “Possessions” renders parikkhāra. For a discussion of the term parikkhāra, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd8:27.5.7.pli: Yaṃ tattha garubhaṇḍaṃ garuparikkhāraṃ taṃ āgatānāgatassa cātuddisassa saṅghassa avissajjikaṃ avebhaṅgikan”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:27.5.7.eng: His valuable possessions are for the Sangha as a whole, both present and future. They’re not to be given out, not to be distributed.”

pli-tv-kd8:28.1.0.eng: 25. Discussion of the prohibition against nakedness

pli-tv-kd8:28.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu naggo hutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd8:28.1.1.eng: On one occasion a naked monk went to the Buddha and said,

pli-tv-kd8:28.1.2.pli: “bhagavā, bhante, anekapariyāyena appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa apacayassa vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇavādī.
pli-tv-kd8:28.1.2.eng: “In many ways, sir, you praise fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, ascetic practices, being inspiring, reduction in things, and being energetic.

pli-tv-kd8:28.1.3.pli: Idaṃ, bhante, naggiyaṃ anekapariyāyena appicchatāya santuṭṭhitāya sallekhāya dhutatāya pāsādikatāya apacayāya vīriyārambhāya saṃvattati.
pli-tv-kd8:28.1.3.eng: Being naked leads to all those things.

pli-tv-kd8:28.1.4.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhūnaṃ naggiyaṃ anujānātū”ti.
pli-tv-kd8:28.1.4.eng: Please allow nakedness for the monks.”

pli-tv-kd8:28.1.6.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:28.1.6.eng: “Foolish man, it’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-kd8:28.1.7.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, naggiyaṃ titthiyasamādānaṃ samādiyissasi.
pli-tv-kd8:28.1.7.eng: How can you undertake the practice of nakedness, like the monastics of other religions?

pli-tv-kd8:28.1.10.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd8:28.1.11.eng: “You shouldn’t undertake the practice of nakedness, like the monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-kd8:28.1.12.eng: If you do, you commit a serious offense.”

pli-tv-kd8:28.2.0.eng: 26. Discussion of the prohibition against grass robes, etc.

pli-tv-kd8:28.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kusacīraṃ nivāsetvā …pe…
pli-tv-kd8:28.2.1.eng: On one occasion a monk put on a sarong made of grass …

pli-tv-kd8:28.2.3.eng: a sarong made of bits of wood …
pli-tv-kd8:28.2.3.comm: Sp 1.67: Phalakacīraṁ nāma phalakasaṇṭhānāni phalakāni sibbitvā katacīraṁ, “Phalakacīra: a robe made by sewing together bits of wood or what has the appearance of wood.”

pli-tv-kd8:28.2.4.eng: a sarong made of human hair …

pli-tv-kd8:28.2.6.eng: a sarong made of owls’ wings …

pli-tv-kd8:28.2.7.eng: a sarong made of antelope hide,

pli-tv-kd8:30.1.0.eng: 28. Discussion of robe-cloth that has not yet been offered to those who have completed the rainy-season residence

pli-tv-kd8:30.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vassaṃvuṭṭhā bhikkhū anuppanne cīvare pakkamantipi, vibbhamantipi, kālampi karonti, sāmaṇerāpi paṭijānanti, sikkhaṃ paccakkhātakāpi paṭijānanti, antimavatthuṃ ajjhāpannakāpi paṭijānanti, ummattakāpi paṭijānanti, khittacittāpi paṭijānanti, vedanāṭṭāpi paṭijānanti, āpattiyā adassane ukkhittakāpi paṭijānanti, āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhittakāpi paṭijānanti, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhittakāpi paṭijānanti, paṇḍakāpi paṭijānanti, theyyasaṃvāsakāpi paṭijānanti, titthiyapakkantakāpi paṭijānanti, tiracchānagatāpi paṭijānanti, mātughātakāpi paṭijānanti, pitughātakāpi paṭijānanti, arahantaghātakāpi paṭijānanti, bhikkhunidūsakāpi paṭijānanti, saṅghabhedakāpi paṭijānanti, lohituppādakāpi paṭijānanti, ubhatobyañjanakāpi paṭijānanti.
pli-tv-kd8:30.1.1.eng: At that time, the monks who had completed the rainy-season residence left before the robe-cloth was offered. pli-tv-kd8:30.2.1.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassaṃvuṭṭho bhikkhu anuppanne cīvare pakkamati, sante patirūpe gāhake dātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd8:30.2.2.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassaṃvuṭṭho bhikkhu anuppanne cīvare vibbhamati, kālaṃ karoti, sāmaṇero paṭijānāti, sikkhaṃ paccakkhātako paṭijānāti, antimavatthuṃ ajjhāpannako paṭijānāti, saṅgho sāmī.

Then the Sangha becomes the owner of that robe-cloth.

pli-tv-kd8:30.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassaṃvuṭṭho bhikkhu uppanne cīvare abhājite pakkamati, sante patirūpe gāhake dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:30.3.1.eng: It may be that, after robe-cloth has been offered but before it’s distributed, a monk who’s completed the rains residence leaves. If there’s anyone suitable to receive the robe-cloth, it should be given.
pli-tv-kd8:30.3.1.comm: “Has been offered” renders uppanna. This word, which literally means “arisen”, varies slightly in meaning dependent on the context. Often it refers to a requisite that has just been given to the Sangha or an individual monastic. Occasionally however, such as here, this does not fit the context, because the giving of the cloth is specifically said to happen afterwards. In other words, here uppanna happens first, and only then is the robe given. The meaning, then, must be that the monks had been given an offer or a promise of robe-cloth, but had not yet received it. In a sense, the robe-cloth had “become available” to them. The most common way for a requisite to become available to a monastic is that an offer is made. I translate accordingly. See also DOP for this meaning of uppanna.

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.1.eng: “Monks, there are these eight key phrases for the giving of robe-cloth:

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.2.pli: sīmāya deti, katikāya deti, bhikkhāpaññattiyā deti, saṅghassa deti, ubhatosaṅghassa deti, vassaṃvuṭṭhasaṅghassa deti, ādissa deti, puggalassa deti.
pli-tv-kd8:32.1.2.eng: someone gives within a monastery zone; someone gives to a recipient who has made an agreement; someone gives where alms are prepared; someone gives to the Sangha; someone gives to both Sanghas; someone gives to a sangha that has completed the rainy-season residence; someone gives according to a specification; someone gives to an individual.
pli-tv-kd8:32.1.2.comm: Sp 3.379: … sīmaṁ parāmasitvā dento sīmāya deti nāma, “… giving while touching the zone is called ‘giving within a zone’.”

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.3.eng: Someone gives within a monastery zone:

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.4.eng: it should be distributed by the monks within that zone.

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.5.eng: Someone gives to a recipient who has made an agreement:

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.6.pli: sambahulā āvāsā samānalābhā honti ekasmiṃ āvāse dinne sabbattha dinnaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd8:32.1.6.eng: when a number of monasteries have the same material support, then when it’s given in one monastery, it’s given to all.
pli-tv-kd8:32.1.6.comm: Sp 3.379: Katikāyāti samānalābhakatikāya. Tenevāha – “sambahulā āvāsā samānalābhā hontī”ti. Tatrevaṁ katikā kātabbā, ekasmiṁ vihāre sannipatitehi bhikkhūhi yaṁ vihāraṁ saṅgaṇhitukāmā samānalābhaṁ kātuṁ icchanti, tassa nāmaṁ gahetvā asuko nāma vihāro porāṇakoti vā buddhādhivutthoti vā appalābhoti vā yaṁkiñci kāraṇaṁ vatvā taṁ vihāraṁ iminā vihārena saddhiṁ ekalābhaṁ kātuṁ saṅghassa ruccatīti tikkhattuṁ sāvetabbaṁ. Ettāvatā tasmiṁ vihāre nisinnopi idha nisinnova hoti, tasmiṁ vihārepi saṅghena evameva kātabbaṁ. Ettāvatā idha nisinnopi tasmiṁ nisinnova hoti. Ekasmiṁ lābhe bhājiyamāne itarasmiṁ ṭhitassa bhāgaṁ gahetuṁ vaṭṭati. Evaṁ ekena vihārena saddhiṁ bahūpi āvāsā ekalābhā kātabbā, “Katikāya: an agreement on equality in material support. Because of this, it was said: Sambahulā āvāsā samānalābhā honti. In regard to this, the agreement is to be made in this way: by the monks gathered in one monastery, in the monastery where they desire to collect (material support) to make an equality in material support, having taken its name, a monastery called such-and-such, whether it is old or was lived in by the Buddha or gets little support, for whatever reason, having said this, he should proclaim three times, “That monastery together with this monastery approves of the Sangha to make a unity in material support.” With this much, even if seated in that monastery, it is as if seated here. Also, if this were to be done by the Sangha in that monastery, then, with this much, even if seated here, it is as if seated there. When distributing the material support in one place, one is allowed to take a share for one in the other. In this way, even many monasteries are to be made a unity in material support with one monastery.”

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.7.pli: Bhikkhāpaññattiyā deti, yattha saṅghassa dhuvakārā kariyyanti, tattha deti.
pli-tv-kd8:32.1.7.eng: Someone gives where alms are prepared: someone gives where the Sangha is regularly working.
pli-tv-kd8:32.1.7.comm: Saṅghassa dhuvakārā kariyyanti can be construed either as the Sangha regularly doing work or as work regularly being done for the Sangha. The commentary merely offer various scenarios for this sort of situation. Sp 3.379: Bhikkhāpaññattiyāti attano pariccāgapaññāpanaṭṭhāne. Tenevāha – “yattha saṅghassa dhuvakārā kariyantī”ti. Tassattho – yasmiṁ vihāre imassa cīvaradāyakassa santakaṁ saṅghassa pākavaṭṭaṁ vā vattati, yasmiṁ vā vihāre bhikkhū attano bhāraṁ katvā sadā gehe bhojeti, yattha vā anena āvāso kārito, salākabhattādīni vā nibaddhāni, yena pana sakalopi vihāro patiṭṭhāpito, tattha vattabbameva natthi, ime dhuvakārā nāma. Tasmā sace so “yattha mayhaṁ dhuvakārā karīyanti, tattha dammī”ti vā “tattha dethā”ti vā bhaṇati, bahūsu cepi ṭhānesu dhuvakārā honti, sabbattha dinnameva hoti, “Bhikkhāpaññattiyā: in the place of preparing one’s own offering. Because of that, this is said: Yattha saṅghassa dhuvakārā kariyanti. This is its meaning: ‘In the monastery where the belongings of this robe-giver are; or where there is a regular supply of cooked food for the Sangha; or in the monastery where, having created their own burden, the monks are always fed in a house; or where a monastery is built by him (Sp-yoj 3.379: cīvaradāyakena, “by the robe-giver”), or when meals decided by lots, etc., are regular, by whom even an entire monastery is established, (even if) nothing is to be done there—these are called regular work. Therefore, if he thinks, “I will give where constant work is being done by me,” or he says, “Give there,” then even if there is constant work in many places, it is given everywhere.’”

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.8.eng: Someone gives to the Sangha: the present Sangha should distribute it.

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.9.pli: Ubhatosaṅghassa deti, bahukāpi bhikkhū honti, ekā bhikkhunī hoti, upaḍḍhaṃ dātabbaṃ, bahukāpi bhikkhuniyo honti, eko bhikkhu hoti, upaḍḍhaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:32.1.9.eng: Someone gives to both Sanghas: even when there are many monks and just a single nun, she should be given half; even when there are many nuns and just a single monk, he should be given half.

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.10.pli: Vassaṃvuṭṭhasaṅghassa deti, yāvatikā bhikkhū tasmiṃ āvāse vassaṃvuṭṭhā, tehi bhājetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd8:32.1.10.eng: Someone gives to a sangha that has completed the rainy-season residence: it’s to be distributed by the monks who have completed the rains residence in that monastery.

pli-tv-kd8:32.1.11.pli: Ādissa deti, yāguyā vā bhatte vā khādanīye vā cīvare vā senāsane vā bhesajje vā.
pli-tv-kd8:32.1.11.eng: Someone gives according to a specification: relating to congee, a meal, fresh food, robe-cloth, a dwelling, or medicine.
pli-tv-kd8:32.1.11.comm: Sp 3.379: Ādissa detīti … Tatrāyaṁ yojanā – bhikkhū ajjatanāya vā svātanāya vā yāguyā nimantetvā tesaṁ gharaṁ paviṭṭhānaṁ yāguṁ deti, yāguṁ datvā pītāya yāguyā “imāni cīvarāni, yehi mayhaṁ yāgu pītā, tesaṁ dammī”ti deti, yehi nimantitehi yāgu pītā, tesaṁyeva pāpuṇāti. “Ādissa deti … This is the meaning: having invited monks to congee on the same or the following day, one then gives congee to those who have entered the house. When the congee has been given and it has been drunk, one then gives, saying, ‘I give these robes to those who drank my congee.’ The drinkers of congee among those who were invited, only they obtain (robes).”
